Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cryptdin-1 (Crp1, cryp01, murine alpha defensins, 3S=S, natural AMPs; UCSS1a; mouse, rodents, mammals, animals)

Literature.Author: Eisenhauer PB, Harwig SSSL., Lehrer RI.1992
Literature.Title: Cryptdins: antimicrobial defensins of the murine small intestine.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: purified from acid extracts of intact mouse jejunum and ileum by a combination of CM-Sepharose chromatography and sequential C-18 reverse-phase HPLC.Activity: Active against E. coli, S. typhimurium, and L. monocytogenes. ALso killed E. coli (99.9% killing at 41.9 ug/ml) and S. aureus (99.9% killing at 11.9 ug/ml) based on virtual colony count assays. This method exposed bacteria to peptides for 2 h in 10 mM phospahtate buffer before incubating in media for 12 h (Wang et al., 2023).Structure: 3 Disulfid bridges: 6, 34; 8, 23; 13, 33.SAR: linearizing the peptide by substituting C with A led to increased activity against E. coli. However, disulfide bonds appear to be important for activity against S. aureus.
